name: Lost for Words! 15 Quiz | Lyrics Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text:
"Well, ______ coast girls are hip 
I really dig those styles they wear."
What word is missing from this Beach Boys song?
questions.explanation:
East.

	These words come from the Beach Boys song "California Girls".  This 1965 hit was written by group member Brian Wilson.

questions.text:
"In the year ______- ______
If man is still alive 
If woman can survive they may find."
Which date are we looking for in this lyric?
questions.explanation:
twenty-five-twenty-five.

	"In the Year 2525" was a hit for Zager and Evan in 1969.  The single was a chart topper in both the US and the UK.

questions.text:
"______ eyes, movin' cross the floor 
Got me wantin' more, ______ eyes
______ eyes, gettin' down with you 
I want to move with you, ______ eyes."
Dr. Hook sang about what type of eyes in this song?
questions.explanation:
Sexy.

	Dr. Hook and the Medicine Show took "Sexy Eyes" into the charts in 1980.  This track peaked at #4 in the UK.

questions.text:
"Well, the rain exploded with a mighty crash 
As we fell into the sun, 
And the first one said to the second one there 
I hope you're having fun 
______ on the run, ______ on the run."
So, what or who was on the run?
questions.explanation:
band.

	"Band on the Run" was a hit for Paul McCartney and Wings in 1974.  The single, which featured on an album of the same name, was a US #1, peaking at #3 in the UK.

questions.text:
"You made me so very ______
I'm so glad you came into my life yeah."
Which of these emotions did the singer feel in this song?
questions.explanation:
happy.

	Blood Sweat and Tears released "You've Made Me So Very Happy" in 1969.  This song was a #2 hit in the US charts, #35 in the UK.

questions.text:
"______ lives in a very bad part of town 
And everybody there tries to put my ______ down."
What name is missing from this lyric?
questions.explanation:
Sloopy.

	The McCoys hit the charts with "Hang On Sloopy" in 1965.  A US chart topper for The McCoys this track peaked at #3 in the UK.

questions.text:
"Hey ______, go ______, soul ______, go ______ 
He met Marmalade down in Old New Orleans 
Struttin' her stuff on the street."
Which member of the family fills the gaps in this lyric?
questions.explanation:
sister.

	"Lady Marmalade" was performed by the US female vocal group LaBelle in 1975.  Lead vocalist Patti LaBelle, real name Patricia Holt, took this single to the top in the US.  "Lady Marmalade" peaked at #17 in the UK.

questions.text:
"Whoo-a, yes they call him the ______ 
Look-a' dat, look-a' dat
Fastest thing on two feet 
Look-a' dat, look-a' dat 
He's just as proud as he can be of his anatomy."
What word is missing from this Ray Stevens novelty song?
questions.explanation:
Streak.

	"The Streak", written and sung by Ray Stevens, was a hit in 1974.  Ray, real name Ray Ragsdale, topped the charts on both sides of the Atlantic with this song.

questions.text:
"Ooh, I hear ______ in the rain 
Walking hand in hand with the one I love 
Ooh, how I love the rainy days 
And the happy way I feel inside."
Which of these noises accompanied the downpour?
questions.explanation:
laughter.

	Neil Sedaka Had a string of hits in the early 1960s.  He had another flurry of hit some ten years later.  "Laughter In The Rain", written by Neil Sedaka and Phil Cody, topped the US charts in 1974.   This single peaked at #15 in the UK.

questions.text:
"Last night I said these words to my girl
I know you never even try, girl
Come on, come on, come on, come on
Please, ______ me, woo-yeah, like I ______ you."
And finally some well-known words from the Beatles?
questions.explanation:
please.

	These lyrics come from the John Lennon and Paul McCartney song "Please Please Me".  The Beatles hit with this track in 1963.
